intro: Scilla nossibeensis, commonly known as the Nossibé scilla, is a flowering plant native to the island of São Miguel in the Azores. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Scilla nossibeensis is known for its ornamental value and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation sites. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
